  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36776].
  {panel}

In Oracle Database there is not a type called boolean. An integer is used instead. This causes problems when generating a JIRA XML backup and restoring it in and instance using another database, as the boolean fields are created as integers when they should be boolean.

This only affects Active Object tables as there is not a column of the type boolean in JIRA database schema.

I have noticed this problems affects the JIRA Agile add-on but it could potentially affect all add-ons which use Active Objects and have a boolean column in their DB tables.

   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at java.util.HashMap.getEntry(Unknown Source)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36768].
  {panel}

Most modern desktops make it convienient to dock windows to use half a monitor's width.  A very common resolution of new monitors is 1920px wide, so it's quite often that I find myself with browsers at 960px (50% of 1920px, including scrollbars and window borders).

It's a minor annoyance that many UI's expect the browser to be just a bit larger than this.  JIRA is one such product which is very close to working flawlessly, but seems to expect a few extra pixels of width.

For example:
 - Having an item open on the JIRA Agile Boards will hide the "X" close button off the side of the screen

 - On the JIRA Issue detail screen buttons at the far right require side-scrolling to reach, such as the "Log Time" button

As a workaround I often zoom the page to 90%, which is OK but has some side effects with various sites
fields.summary: Ensure JIRA UI is compatible with browsers at 960px (50% of 1920)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36767].
  {panel}

I have a JQL search which is supposed to return all issues which I am watching but not the assignee or reporter. The original search I wrote is:

status != closed and watcher = "myusername" and reporter != "myusername" and assignee != "myusername"

However, it appears that the parameter "assignee != "myusername" " does not return issues that are completely unassigned, which means I had to alter the search to be:

resolution = EMPTY and watcher = "myusername" and reporter != "myusername" and (assignee != "myusername" or assignee is empty).

This seems like bad logic to me; if an issue is unassigned, its by definition not assigned to me. Can this be fixed?

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36757].
  {panel}

Many customers have project keys that are not similar to the project name.
When creating an issue people want to be able to select the project by entering the first few letters of the project key, as well as doing that for the project name.

The proposed change is that the displayed project when creating an issue should look like

Project Name (Project Key)

and that a project should be selectable by typing characters that start the project key as well as the project name.

The test case for this would be a project named "My Test Project" with a project key of "AAA". Typing AAA should offer the project "My Test Project (AAA)"
fields.summary: Show project name and key when creating an issue

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36748].
  {panel}

JQL does not validate string with dot "." properly. For example, username with a dot e.g. test.user. JQL will show it as an invalid query. This is known to affect versions name as well. 

The string need to be enclosed with quotes before it will be a valid string.

h3. Expected Results
The string will either get enclosed by quotes automatically or it is validated as a valid string without quotes.
fields.summary: JQL does not validate string with dot "." properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36744].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The Windows installer installs JIRA using a service id of "JIRA" + installation time stamp.
In an enterprise environment this is impractical because you have to change the sevice name after every JIRA update in startup scripts, GPO's etc.

I would like you to change this behaviour so that the installer uses a short service name which doesn't change.


h4. Workaround
To rename the older instance's service name.
# Try to find the older service ID for example: JIRA101214115546
# Replace the ID in the following command and preferred new name for older service instead of "Atlassian JIRA"
{code}
SC Config "JIRA101214115546" DisplayName= "Atlassian JIRA 6.3.14"
{code}
Now your older version has been renamed.
Try to install the new service!
fields.summary: Generalize Windows service name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36740].
  {panel}

Currently we only show when a group is used in:

* Permission Schemes
* Notification Schemes
* Issue Security Schemes
* Shared filters

A more complete list of locations where a group can be used is:

* Permission Schemes
* Notification Schemes
* Issue Security Schemes
* Shared filters
* Project Roles
* Global Permissions
* Custom field values
* Post functions in workflows
* Conditions in workflows
* Shared dashboards
* Filter subscriptions
* Plugins (we can't help check this one, because we don't know how plugins will use this)

We should extend this functionality to check as many places as possible because understanding the impact of changes to groups is very difficult for admins at this time.

You can work around this in part given the queries at: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+identify+group+usage+in+JIRA
fields.summary: Extend Group administration page to show more use locations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36739].
  {panel}

For organizations that re-use Workflow Schemes across hundreds of projects, the new Draft Editing feature introduced in JRA-5254 can be very slow, bringing an instance to its knees.

I think this could catch many admins off-guard. For us with 230 projects re-using a Workflow Scheme, it takes about 20 minutes to finish. Just going to the initial first step (1 of 2) takes about 2 minutes.

There are some slow DB queries as well...this one for example takes 100 seconds and is called 70 times:

{code}
SELECT JI.ID FROM jiraissue JI INNER JOIN OS_WFENTRY WE ON JI.WORKFLOW_ID = WE.ID WHERE ((JI.issuetype=?) AND 
(JI.PROJECT IN (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
 ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
  ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
   ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
    ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
     ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
      ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, 
      ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, 
      ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?,
       ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) )) AND (WE.NAME <> ? )
{code}

I think the risk here is that it could leave some issues in an invalid state if users are actively using JIRA while this long tasks finishes.
fields.summary: Workflow Scheme Draft Editing slow in large instances

As per the [Turning off Form Token Checking|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA043/Form+Token+Handling#FormTokenHandling-TurningoffFormTokenChecking], the ability to turn off Form Token Checking is only available up to *JIRA 4.3.x*.

After that, {{jira-application.properties}} is only used to configure [JIRA Home Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Home+Directory]. No update on how to disable the Form Token Checking anymore as it was totally removed from the documentation and moved to JIRA Plugin Development Page:
* [Form Token Handling|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Form+Token+Handling]

Is there any way to address this ability in JIRA 6.x.x? Included the parameter in [jira-config.properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+JIRA+Configuration#AdvancedJIRAConfiguration-Thejira-config.propertiesfile] but it is not working.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36720].
  {panel}

When using the two dimensional filter statistics gadget and adding a Select List as one of the axes, a user can choose to sort either by *Total* or *Natural*. 
Natural sorts by alphabetical order while total sorts by total issues. 
There should be a sort option for sorting based on the *options list* as configured in the custom field itself. 

E.g. say we have the following options configured in the custom field, of the same order:
Very low
Low
Medium
High
Very High

We can't sort them like this using either of the Total or Natural sort options for the gadget.

WORKAROUND:
# Rename the options to have a numerical value in front to reflect the sorting position, and have the gadget sort by Natural.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget should allow sorting of values as configured in select list custom field

fields.description:
Hello,

Worklog details for a specific issue can be obtained from /rest/api/latest/issue/59022/worklog however it can't be obtained from the search API. The call /rest/api/2/search?jql=createdDate > "2014/1/1"&expand=worklog does not work as I would have expected. No worklog information will be returned.

Please my apologies if this is to be considered a feature request instead in which case feel free to change it to bug.

It would be great if JIRA REST API would return more detailed information for all bugs contained in a JQL. The "expand" parameter works with custom fields but I can't figure how to expand the worklog. Getting the results of the JQL and iterating one issue at a time to get the worklog details is overkilling.

I know you can do this with paid plugins but such functionality I believe should be provided out of the box.

Thanks,

- Nestor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36676].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
The currently widely used IPv4 address pool is close to exhaustion: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv4_address_exhaustion]. IPv6 is around already for a while, however parts of our products may (and do) break.

Government related projects, such as DOE Government agencies, require teams involved in the projects to be 100% IPv6

h4. Requirement
- Add IPv6 tests for products and clarify it being supported for all parts of the products (external system connectivity, applinks, self-naming, reverse-proxying, etc).
- Update the supported platforms documentation and explicitly specify IPv6 to be supported to avoid confusion and give support a reference point.
- IPV6 for data egress and data ingress in Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: IPv6 Support for JIRA
Create a page for User Default Settings for JIRA documentation
Support for Kinect Camera instead of Touch Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36672].
  {panel}

h3. Problem:

We no longer have updated docs for classes such as https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/jira/5.1.8/reference/com/atlassian/jira/plugins/mail/handlers/package-summary.html from JIRA 5.1.8 onwards.

The code is still there, however it's not part of the official docs as the majority of JIRA code is focusing on moving to plugins and the plugin documentation is not considered to be part of the main JIRA API docs (ie the devs don't consider this to be the main API of JIRA). In JIRA we have a package that contains the main API classes and those are the ones we use ourselves. These mail handler docs rely on that API package - that is the official API. We also have a lot of classes that we expose, which means plugin devs can use them, however don't mark them as being part of the official API.

Plugin devs could use the exposed classes, however they're not supposed to and should be using the API instead. This is the risk of using them - they are not official and may not continue to be documented or supported and can change any versions. Official API will always be documented and always supported. It will change, however it will be for major versions only (part of the whole stable API thing) and also have all the details displayed. I've been told this is not a deliberate decision, just a side effect of moving code out of JIRA core and into plugins. As it has been moved, docs are no longer publicly available.

In this example, they should be using https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/latest/com/atlassian/jira/service/util/handler/MessageHandler.html a it is official. We have an example at [Custom Message (Mail) Handler for JIRA|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Custom+Message+(Mail)+Handler+for+JIRA].

h3. Request

Can you please publish Javadocs for plugins that used to be part of JIRA core, or mention this in the JIRA release notes for plugin developers so they aren't left in the dark.

Thanks :)

fields.summary: Login failure with internal JIRA user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36646].
  {panel}

When first logging in to JIRA, the last dashboard the user accessed is displayed via the URL:
 
https://domain.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa

The dashboard ID is not listed.  It would be useful if the ID was displayed in the URL, so that it could be copied/pasted, like:

https://domain.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=16122
fields.summary: Full URL to dashboard should be displayed on last dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36645].
  {panel}

Currently the following features are available:
* Email subscriptions for Issue Filters
* Excel export for Issue Filters

Customers might want to combine these two features in a sense that an excel export file of a specific filter will be attached to the emails sent periodically to a subscribed email address.
fields.summary: Excel attachments for Filter subscriptions

fields.summary: Sorting custom fields crashs JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36637].
  {panel}

Our users have been assigned to new groups on the basis of a corporate restructuring. The group names have been used for sharing filters, dashboards and comments.

If I delete the old groups, then JIRA asks for a new group name so that shared comments can be changed to the new group. That's great!

Unfortunately, this does not apply shared filters and dashboards. The filters and dashboards are no longer shared for other users.

Therefore, we have stopped deleting the groups. However, new employees are not added to the old groups. This will end in chaos, because we do not know exactly whether groups are still needed or not. The system becomes increasingly cluttered.

It would be nice if the shares of filters and dashboards could be changed to a different group, if groups are deleted. So just as it is already done for comments.
fields.summary: When deleting a group, I should be prompted to change the sharing information for dashboards and filters
Jira gadget header text color should be editable in look & feel
Request for EntityResource documentation update

fields.description:
*To Reproduce*

1. Use the Search filter to find a sprint for a given board
2. Export the sprint into an Excel spreadsheet
3. Click on a ticket link in the spreadsheet to open this ticket in the browser
4. Presented with a login screen - type in login details and click "Keep Me Logged In"
5. From the excel spreadsheet Click on a new ticket link to view this in the browser
6. Presented with a login screen even though "Keep Me Logged In" was ticked.

Can also reproduce this issue on Confluence using different steps
fields.summary: "Keep Me Logged In" doesn't work when viewing tickets from exported sprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36632].
  {panel}

As a Jira user viewing a sub-task of a user story (New Feature, Improvement etc.) I want to directly navigate to next sub-task so that I save time.

Now, when I see details of a sub-task I need to navigate to "parent" issue, using the link above the Summary, then I am able to enter another sub-task.

Would be great if you add the same navigation mechanism already implemented for search results. Check attached screenshot. This way a Jira user could navigate, browse through the all sub-tasks of same issue (user story, new feature etc.) without having to navigate to parent issue all the time.

Thanks,
Alin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36617].
  {panel}

The current Project Overview Page shows on the below items:
* Summary
* Issues
* Reports
* Calendar
* Components

Few items such as [*Labels*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Browsing+a+Project's+Labels] and possibly other items are currently missing. 

The issue have been noticed on few customers and dev instances as well. Two screen-shots have been attached showing the previous and current project overview.


*Workaround*
Customers can use Label gadget on dashboard to browse project labels.
In order to view all labels on the instance, run this query in the database : {code}select * from label;{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* As an admin user go to the view issue page.
* Click on the "Admin" dropdown.
* Select "where is my field?

h3. Actual Results

* The dialog show is quite large and wider than necessary for the contents being rendered. See screenshot.

h3. Expected Results

* The dialog size is appropriate for the contents in it.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36605].
  {panel}

I was looking at a filter I'd created, and wondered what the ★ meant next to "Details". I clicked it, and suddenly everything disappeared — as though the filter had been deleted. This was very shocking — it was no longer in the Issues menu, it wasn't under Favourite Filters (on the left), and when I click "Manage Filters" it wasn't there either. I eventually realised it was under the "My" category in "Manage Filters", but it was a jarring experience.

I propose that when you unfavourite a filter that you're currently looking at, you remain looking at it.

Check the attachments for a video demonstration.

h5. Testing notes
Details of Test Heuristics can be found at http://go/stopsu 

*Stress*
* Sequential clicks to favourite and unfavourite a filter

*Time* 
* Render an existing filter, delete it in another window, refresh the first page

*Operations* 
* N/A

*Platform* 
* JIRA 6.3, 6.4 and 7.0
* IE 9-11, Firefox, Chrome, Safari

*Security* 
* N/A

*Usability* 
* Star icon should always be visible, representing the expected state: on or off
* A filter can be removed or favourited using the sidebar, the following scenarios are expected:
** A filter is favourited using the sidebar: star state should reflect the new state
** A filter is removed using the sidebar: search header should be updated to reflect this state
* (Un)Favourite action should be a two-way update between the sidebar and the header.

*Other*
* N/A
fields.summary: When unfavouriting an issue filter that you're currently using, it disappears!
